content.thinking: I need to extract information from this Colombian identification document (Cédula de Ciudadanía) following the detailed instructions and format requirements. I can see "REPUBLICA DE COLOMBIA" and "IDENTIFICACION PERSONAL CEDULA DE CIUDADANIA" at the top of the document. ## Information Fields Visible: The document shows both the front and back sides of the ID. Front side: - NUMERO: 7.534.022 - APELLIDOS: RESTREPO PEREZ - NOMBRES: JORGE DIEGO - Signature of the holder Back side: - FECHA DE NACIMIENTO (Birth date): 05-JUN-1960 - ARMENIA (QUINDIO) (Birth place) - LUGAR DE NACIMIENTO (Birth place) - 1.66 ESTATURA (Height) - O+ G.S. RH (Blood type) - M SEXO (Sex, male) - 08-MAR-1979 ARMENIA (Issue date and place) - FECHA Y LUGAR DE EXPEDICION (Issue date and place) - Fingerprint and barcode ## Extraction of Required Fields: 1. **firstName**: "JORGE DIEGO" - clearly shown under NOMBRES 2. **lastName**: "RESTREPO PEREZ" - clearly shown under APELLIDOS 3. **country_issuer**: "Colombia" - evident from "REPUBLICA DE COLOMBIA" header 4. **nationality**: "Colombia" - default assumption based on country_issuer 5. **identificationType**: "Cédula de Ciudadanía" - clearly shown in document title 6. **identificationNumber**: "7.534.022" - shown under NUMERO 7. **message**: "" - no issues with document validity or field extraction This document is clear and all fields are easily identifiable, so I don't need to use contextual inference methods.
